attributes.action: confirm that we do not support British Waterways plans for the removal of licensed boats from the long-term moorings on the Sawley Cut
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In view of Bw's latest round of moorings closures in which they aim to reduce online mooring by means of , when a new offline marina opens the marina's total births is to be counted and of that number 10% of local online moorings is to be reduced . Not by voluntary means or by natural wastage but by evicting fully paid up existing moorer's ! To this end with the opening of Pillings marina (River Soar) with 280 births . So 28 local online moorer's are to be evicted including those at Sawley cut (river Trent)which is a well established 
mooring causing no problems to navigation. Moorer's with small boats would have to pay a minimum length fee for a marina birth and Pillings lock does not have planning permission for Residential! boats So there are no alternative moorings available !

Please sign our petition to save our mooring .

Thank you.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "confirm that we do not support British Waterways plans for the removal of licensed boats from the long-term moorings on the Sawley Cut."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page16593


Prime Minister's Office
